document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Haplotropis Saussure, 1888 (Orthoptera: Pamphagidae), with notes on classification of the subfamilies Pamphaginae and Trinchinae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Haplotropis Saussure, 1888 (Orthoptera: Pamphagidae), with notes on classification of the subfamilies Pamphaginae and Trinchinae

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 1 – 18. Haplotropis brunneriana. (Figures 1, 9, 13 after Storozhenko, 1986; figures 10, 11 after Furukawa, 1939 with emendations; other figures original). 1, female, lateral view; 2, female head and pronotum, dorsal view; 3, male head, frontal view; 4, male sternal plate, ventral view; 5, female apex of abdomen, lateral view; 6 – the same, ventral view; 7, male apex of abdomen, lateral view; 8, the same, dorsal view; 9, the base of male abdomen, lateral view; 10, male right tegmen; 11, male right hind wing; 12, male left mid tibia, lateral view; 13, male hind femur, lateral view; 14, 15, female pronotum, lateral view (both females from China: Guntshulin); 16 – 18, apex of male subgenital plate, dorsal view (all specimens from Russia: Klimoutsy).
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 19 – 22. Haplotropis brunneriana, male genitalia (Russia: Lyalichi). (Original). 19, phallic complex, lateral view (epiphallus removed); 20, penis, lateral view; 21, phallic complex, dorsal view (epiphallus removed); 22, epiphallus, dorsal view. Abbreviations: Ap—apical valves of penis; Apd—apodemes; Art—articulated connection between the separated basal and apical valves of the penis; Bp—basal valves of penis; Clf—cleft; Ejd—ejaculatory duct; Ejs—ejaculatory sac; Fu—the place of junction of parts of the phallic organ, severed by dissection; Pht—phallotreme; Zyg—zygoma.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 23. Haplotropis brunneriana, melanic male. (Photo by D. Yu. Rogatnykh).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–18.
Haplotropis brunneriana .
(Figures 1, 9, 13 after Storozhenko, 1986; figures 10, 11 after Furukawa, 1939 with emendations; other figures original). 1, female, lateral view; 2, female head and pronotum, dorsal view; 3, male head, frontal view; 4, male sternal plate, ventral view; 5, female apex of abdomen, lateral view; 6 – the same, ventral view; 7, male apex of abdomen, lateral view; 8, the same, dorsal view; 9, the base of male abdomen, lateral view; 10, male right tegmen; 11, male right hind wing; 12, male left mid tibia, lateral view; 13, male hind femur, lateral view; 14, 15, female pronotum, lateral view (both females from China: Guntshulin); 16 – 18, apex of male subgenital plate, dorsal view (all specimens from Russia: Klimoutsy).

FIGURES 19–22.
Haplotropis brunneriana
,
male genitalia (Russia: Lyalichi). (Original). 19, phallic complex, lateral view (epiphallus removed); 20, penis, lateral view; 21, phallic complex, dorsal view (epiphallus removed); 22, epiphallus, dorsal view. Abbreviations: Ap—apical valves of penis; Apd—apodemes; Art—articulated connection between the separated basal and apical valves of the penis; Bp—basal valves of penis; Clf—cleft; Ejd—ejaculatory duct; Ejs—ejaculatory sac; Fu—the place of junction of parts of the phallic organ, severed by dissection; Pht—phallotreme; Zyg—zygoma.

FIGURE 23.
Haplotropis brunneriana
, melanic male. (Photo by D.Yu. Rogatnykh).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Redescription. Width of vertex between eyes in male
3.7 – 3.9
times, in female
4.1 – 4.8
times wider than the width of frontal ridge between antennae. Mid segments of antennae
2.3 – 2.6
times as long as wide. Vertical diameter of eyes in male 1.1 times larger, in female equal or 1.1 times shorter than subocular furrow. Metazona in male
1.3 – 1.4
times, in female
1.4 – 1.6
times shorter than prozona. Tegmina in male 1.3 – 2.0 times, in female
1.3 – 1.7
times as long as wide. Hind wings as long as tegmina. Hind femora in male
3.6 – 3.9
times, in female
3.3 – 3.6
times as long as wide. Male cerci conical,
1.7 – 2.6
times as long as wide near the base; in female cerci very short,
1.1 – 1.3
times longer than or as long as wide. Male supra-anal plate
1.4 – 1.7
times as long as wide near the base; in female
1.3 – 1.4
times as long as wide. Subgenital plate in male in dorsal view with pointed or bifurcated apex. Dorsal and ventral valves of ovipositor not serrated, with pointed apex.

Measurements (in mm). Length of body male 28.2 – 44.0, female 34.5 – 51.0; pronotum male
9.5 – 14.3
, female 10.5 – 17.0; tegmen male 5.0 – 9.6 , female
5.5 – 9.1
; hind femur male 14.2 – 21.0, female
15.5 – 23.3
.

Distribution. China (Jiangsu, Anhui, Shandong, Shanxi, Hebei, Henan, Inner Mongolia , Ningxia, Shaanxi, Gansu, Liaoning, Jilin, Heilongjiang), Korea (continental part from north to south), Russia (East Siberia, Far East), Mongolia .

Remark. The length and shape of tegmina of
H . neimongolensis
(see
Jin, 1994
: fig. 145 a) is the same as in holotype of
H. brunneriana
(see Saussure, 1888 : pl. 2 , fig. 10 ); the shape of posterior margin of pronotum is variable in
H. brunneriana
from obtuse to acute angulated. Therefore herein
H . neimongolensis
Jin, 1994
is considered as a pure synonym of
H. brunneriana
.
